Quantitative Research (QR) is an expert quantitative modeling group in J.P. Morgan, as well as a leader in financial engineering, data analytics, statistical modeling and portfolio management. We are looking for a talented Quant to join the Quantitative Research CIB Payments team in New York. As part of the Corporate and Investment Bank, the Payments business generated over $9bn of revenue in 2023, holding cash deposits in excess of $400bn with a global presence beyond 160 countries.

You will be part of a newly formed team that will support the Liquidity and Account Solutions team within Payments, optimizing Net Interest Income and client pricing through the innovative use of data analytics, time series analysis and machine learning. About This Role

Within American Express, Global Merchant & Network Services (GMNS) is dedicated to supporting Amex-accepting merchants globally.

The Merchant Digital Analytics & Research team owns UX research, data capability, and digital analytics for merchant-facing digital experiences. These include secure servicing journeys such as online statements and disputes, and publicly available resources such as the merchant-focused Shop Small landing page. Our high-performing team collects and synthesizes a variety of data inputs to understand user needs and present a view of product performance and recommendations to product teams and senior leadership. Data sources we draw on include big data tables (Cornerstone/Google Cloud Platform), Adobe Analytics and Qualtrics.

We are seeking a Digital Analyst. This entry-level role is ideal for someone who is looking to gain experience in digital data collection; analyzing data from disparate sources to solve business problems; and working across functions to build and measure the best possible digital experiences.

The position is hybrid, with the option to work from home up to two days per week. The remaining three days per week will be in our New York City offices.

Ensure data accuracy by conducting thorough, well-documented QA of tagging implementations, and working with technology teams to ensure problems are understood and remediated
Assist with implementation of Qualtrics onsite surveys
Own and maintain a portfolio of recurring reports, alerts, and dashboards
Work in close collaboration with product owners, technology teams and marketing partners to communicate product performance and stay informed of product changes
Leverage qualitative, quantitative, and demographic data to analyze product performance and make recommendations
Manage ad-hoc requests for digital data analysis from a variety of stakeholder teams
Present findings and outcomes to all levels of the organization with confidence and clarity

Required Qualifications

Excellent communication and documentation skills
Ability to excel as a team player in a fast-paced, complex business environment and rigorously prioritize competing initiatives
Ability to operate effectively under changing conditions
Drive for excellence, with the desire to optimize processes for best efficiency and results
Analytical curiosity to observe and understand human behavior on digital platforms
Basic understanding of web technologies like HTML and JavaScript
1-2 years of experience with SQL or equivalent educational background, with capability to join, manipulate and summarize large datasets
1-2 years professional experience or equivalent educational background

Preferred Qualifications (these Are Not Required)

Exposure to tag management tools (e.g. Adobe Launch, Ensighten) and digital analytics tools (e.g. Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics)
Exposure to web diagnostic tools such as Omnibug, Charles Proxy or Chrome Developer tools
